snippet: The meeting is the most striking example yet of the new king’s willingness to work with Islamist organizations that the kingdom has long considered foes.
abstract: King Salman of Saudi Arabia meets with Hamas leaders, reflection of his goal of rallying Arab world against Iran; Salman's predecessor had pursued opposite tactic of eradicating Muslim Brotherhood and affiliates like Hamas.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon. Majd Al Waheidi contributed reporting from Gaza, Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: The meeting is the most striking example yet of the new king’s willingness to work with Islamist organizations that the kingdom has long considered foes.

headline.main: King Salman of Saudi Arabia Meets With Hamas Leaders
headline.print_headline: Saudi King Has Meeting With Leaders of Hamas

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
